result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

1:29 p.m.  PC hearing/bond hrg.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def appears via Zoom from ICJ.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Court finds PC.  Right to atty explained.  Def understands.  DA to make sure def gets PCS/jd (all pages).  DA requests $1,000 sig bond, no special conditions.  Initial to be set on 1/31/22.  Court explains sig bond and what it means.  Court questions def further re ties to community, etc.  No objection from def re bond.  Court sets $1,000 sig bond.  Initial app to be set for 1/31 at 9:00 a.m.  Public def info to be provided to def.  No questions.  Adj.  klr
